result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order Appointing Counsel (Includes 22CF519 and 22CF900)

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 2:32 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF519, 22CF900.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech for ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ, pro se.

Date and time set for SPD attorney review hearing; VRCW. 
Defendant states he has not heard from SPD and is still waiting for counsel.  
COURT recites Doc. 51 from SPD to Court re: numerous attempts at finding counsel. 
Court appoints Attorney Jay Kronenwetter @ $100/hr. not to exceed $4500.00 without further order of the Court. 

COURT continues to extend time limits.  

COURT sets JPTC/RH for 11/14/22 at 2:00 p.m. 

COURT will allow Atty Kronenwetter to request hearing at earlier date. 

Adj: 2:36 p.m.
SPD Attorney Status

Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed. 
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Review set for 09/14/2022 @ 2:30 pm, Branch 4. (to review attorney status).

SPD Attorney Status

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:21 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF519, 22CF900.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.  
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Heather Roehr for Atty Natasha VanLieshout. 

Date and time set for motion hearing; VRCW. 
Atty Roehr makes statement; motion to withdraw filed by Atty VanLieshout was due to conflict. 
COURT grants motion to withdraw. 

Atty Roehr states defendant is requesting an indigency hearing however, deft qualifies for SPD.  
COURT cannot proceed with count appointment and directs Atty Roehr to advise SPD office to continue looking for counsel. 
COURT addresses defendant and advises will set these matters for attorney review hearings. 

COURT continues on RH 8/12/22 at 1:00 p.m., Courtroom B. 

Adj:  1:24 p.m.
Review hearing on August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Marisa.  
Case Called: 1:06 pm 
INCLUDES 22CF900 & 22CF519. 
Deft appears by video from MCJ, pro se. 
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed. 
Court notes SPD's office has indicated they have made 65 additional contacts. 
Deft requests court appointed attorney. 
COURT advises SPD's office is seeking counsel for deft and Court will not appt an atty at this time. 
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Review set for 8/12/2022 at 1:00 pm in Courtroom B.

SPD Status of Counsel Report

Review hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Co-Defendant Frederick Coleman; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Prints and photograph. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:16 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.   Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Vanessa Avila. 

Date and time set for initial appearance;  VRCW.  
Reading Waived. 
Reserve Jurisdiction. 

BOND:  $5,000.00 cash bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with co-deft, Frederick Coleman. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- ATTIC services at level 4. 

RH:  7/29/22 at 1:00 p.m. 
PH:  8/03/22 at 9:10 a.m., Branch 6. 
PTC:  8/03/22 at 3:00 p.m. 

Adj:  2:20 p.m. 

Branch 4.
